channel.title: Few glitches and bugs
channel.description:
Hello, I have some glitches and and bugs which I need someone to explain me why and how to fix them please?
I'll start with the commands:
::checkbank (bugged - Disconnects you) ::interface (bugged - Disconnects you) ::gfx (bugged - Freezes the client) ::tele (bugged - Disconnects you) ::update (bugged - Disconnects you) ::switch (bugged - Disconnects you) ::setlevel (Doesnt seem to work) -- Supposed to give level to x player, but does nothing
And then I have the run, its infinity, it stays @ 100
And there is no autocast, I tried to add it. It shows put when I click on it nothing happens. It seems like the server have it but its somehow disables
And there is a monster which acts rlly weird when I hit him or when he dies (Hill giant) [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/3jUcZru.png[/img]
Skype: Amir.Amoore
Thanks a lot!!

item.title: Few glitches and bugs
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Terraforming, post:17, topic:544296”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663176.msg4432516#msg4432516 date=1403891835]
Show us the code for all your commands that are bugged. Can’t help otherwise…

The hill giant: give him a real attack and defense animation and he won’t look like hell.

The skeletons: Their model has been replaced when someone packed new objects/items/etc. Use a different skeleton ID.

For converting money:

[code=java]
String input = “1m”;
int converted = getMoneyConvert(input);
/**

  • Note:
  • This was wrote in the reply box as an edit
    **/
    public int getMoneyConvert(String input) {
    input = input.replaceAll(“k”, “000”);
    input = input.replaceAll(“m”, “000000”);
    input = input.replaceAll(“b”, “000000000”);
    int value = Integer.parseInt(input);
    if(value < 0)
    value = 1;
    return value;
    }[/code]
    [/quote]

:palm:

Most retarded way to do it.[/quote]
Not exactly. It was a quick way. The most retarded way to do it would be to store all the valid characters array and then loop through the array to see if the string contained the character and if it did then replace it.

Read full topic

@Death_Style wrote:

^\d+([kmb])?$

Should validate and capture the abbreviation if there is one.

item.title: Few glitches and bugs
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:10, topic:544296”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663176.msg4432516#msg4432516 date=1403891835]

For converting money:

[code=java]
String input = “1m”;
int converted = getMoneyConvert(input);
/**

  • Note:
  • This was wrote in the reply box as an edit
    **/
    public int getMoneyConvert(String input) {
    input = input.replaceAll(“k”, “000”);
    input = input.replaceAll(“m”, “000000”);
    input = input.replaceAll(“b”, “000000000”);
    int value = Integer.parseInt(input);
    if(value < 0)
    value = 1;
    return value;
    }[/code]
    [/quote]

You a basic bitch? What if someone puts kkkkkk, causes an exception, crashes the server. I’ll give you a hint on how to make this example a little bit less retarded: “\d{1,9}[kmb]”[/quote]
Are you still mad about me cracking a joke?
Lol. I was just writing a quick solution, never once did I say it is the best or most efficient.

Read full topic

item.title: Few glitches and bugs

item.title: Few glitches and bugs
item.dc:creator: @Sessy_Pk3r Sessy Pk3r
item.description:
@Sessy_Pk3r wrote:

Most sources parse through the npc’s id rather than it’s name so you’ll have to look up the id for each npc.

Read full topic

item.title: Few glitches and bugs
item.dc:creator: @amiroslo amiroslo
item.description:
@amiroslo wrote:

[quote=“Sessy Pk3r, post:5, topic:544296”]For each npc you’ll have to set the correct animations (walking, attacking, death and other nonsense).
They’re usually set in the NpcHandler class or loaded through xml or some other data file.
I did a quick search for you and found this.
If those don’t work try ripping them from another source. [/quote]

Mine is totally different, I mean my NpcHandler, and it doesnt say where the hill giant is etc. I tried to look diff sources but none had NpcHandler :S

I tried another one, but still same prob, maybe its not from npchandler?

Read full topic

item.title: Few glitches and bugs
item.dc:creator: @Sessy_Pk3r Sessy Pk3r
item.description:
@Sessy_Pk3r wrote:

For each npc you’ll have to set the correct animations (walking, attacking, death and other nonsense).
They’re usually set in the NpcHandler class or loaded through xml or some other data file.
I did a quick search for you and found this.
If those don’t work try ripping them from another source.

Read full topic

item.title: Few glitches and bugs
item.dc:creator: @amiroslo amiroslo
item.description:
@amiroslo wrote:

[quote=“Sessy Pk3r, post:3, topic:544296”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=663176.msg4432153#msg4432153 date=1403708829]
You can’t parse 13m as an integer to my knowledge. You would have to make your own function that tells it to add 0s when it reads an M.
[/quote]
This ^

The NPCbits aren’t congruent (I think that’s the right wording?) meaning the server is sending bits that the client cannot read which is probably why you can’t see them.

The hill giant’s npcDefinitions aren’t correct which is why it looks bugged. Try editing them (server-sided)

And for the run staying at 100, you probably don’t have a function to get the updated run percentage or a method to even drain it. Try creating those.[/quote]

I fixed the k/m/b thingy
and I found a workaround for the invisible monster

I didnt understand the hill giants part. can u explain more, where how and what? Im still new into this
and how do i exactly create a function to update run precentage or a method to drain it? :S

Read full topic

item.title: Few glitches and bugs
item.dc:creator: @Sessy_Pk3r Sessy Pk3r
item.description:
@Sessy_Pk3r wrote:

Death Style:

You can’t parse 13m as an integer to my knowledge. You would have to make your own function that tells it to add 0s when it reads an M.

This ^

The NPCbits aren’t congruent (I think that’s the right wording?) meaning the server is sending bits that the client cannot read which is probably why you can’t see them.

The hill giant’s npcDefinitions aren’t correct which is why it looks bugged. Try editing them (server-sided)

And for the run staying at 100, you probably don’t have a function to get the updated run percentage or a method to even drain it. Try creating those.

Read full topic

item.title: Few glitches and bugs
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

If you are getting disconnected my first guess is that they are sending the incorrect frames for your revision.

Getting frozen suggests you are using a gfx that doesn’t exist.

You can’t parse 13m as an integer to my knowledge. You would have to make your own function that tells it to add 0s when it reads an M.

Read full topic
